etymology.description: 企(企) (qǐ, "to plan or stand on tiptoe") and 图(圖) (tú, "to plan or intend")
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 企(企) (qǐ, "to plan or stand on tiptoe") and 图(圖) (tú, "to plan or intend") expresses the notion of actively planning or intending to achieve a goal. Both components involve aspects of making a deliberate effort or intention.

parts.english: to plan; stand on tiptoe; look forward to
to plan; to scheme; intention; chart

examples.chinese: 他企图逃跑(他企圖逃跑)。
公司企图拓展市场(公司企圖拓展市場)，忽视了内部管理(忽視了內部管理)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī qǐtú tuòzhǎn shìchǎng, hūshìle nèibù guǎnlǐ.
examples.english: The company attempted to expand into the market while neglecting internal management.

examples.chinese: 他企图说服老师(他企圖說服老師)，改变态度(改變態度)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐtú shuōfú lǎoshī, gǎibiàn tàidù.
examples.english: He attempted to persuade his teacher to change his attitude.
